19th International Conference on Natural Language Processing

December 16th - 19th, 2022

Welcome to ICON 2022!

The nineteenth International Conference on Natural Language Processing (ICON-2022) will be held at IIIT Delhi, India during December 15-18, 2022. The ICON Conference series is a forum for promoting interaction among researchers in the field of Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Computational Linguistics (CL) in India and abroad. The main conference is on December 16-17, 2022. This will be preceded by one day of pre-conference tutorials / workshops on December 15, 2021 and one day of post conference shared tasks / tools / demos on December 18, 2022.

Papers in ICON proceedings will be indexed in ACL Anthology. ACL Anthology is a digital archive of research papers in Computational Linguistics for major international conferences under Association for Computational Linguistics (ACL), which is one of the most well-known associations for NLP and CL.

Papers are invited on substantial, original and unpublished research on all aspects of Natural Language Processing, with a particular focus on South Asian languages and other less resourced languages, issues, and applications relevant to South Asia. However, other languages of the world are not excluded. The areas of interest include, but are not limited to:

  • Phonology
  • Morphology
  • Syntax
  • Semantics
  • Discourse
  • POS Tagging
  • Parsing
  • Pragmatics
  • Ontology
  • Word Sense Disambiguation
  • Machine Translation Statistical
  • Machine Translation
  • Computational Psycholinguistics
  • Statistical Methods
  • Knowledge-based Methods
  • Annotation and Annotated Corpora
  • Lexical Resources
  • Sentiment Analysis
  • Machine Learning in NLP
  • NLP-based Recommendation Systems
  • Performance Evaluation of NLP Systems
  • Information Retrieval
  • Information Extraction
  • Question Answering, Dialog Systems
  • Speech Corpora, Speech Recognition
  • Speech Synthesis
  • NLP for Language Documentation and Preservation
  • NLP for Educational Purposes
  • NLP for Digital Humanities

Important Dates

  • Paper Submission Deadline:   Sep 25, 2022
  • Doctoral Consortium Deadline:   Sep 25, 2022
  • Workshop Proposals Deadline:   Sep 15, 2022
  • Workshop Acceptance Notification:   Sep 30, 2022
  • Tutorial Proposals Deadline:   Oct 15, 2022
  • Tutorial Acceptance Notification:   Oct 30, 2022
  • Paper (Main and Doctoral Consortium) Acceptance Notification:   Nov 15, 2022
  • Camera-ready Submission Deadline:   Dec 01, 2022
  • Conference:   Dec 15 - 18, 2022
    • Pre-conference Tutorial / Workshop:   Dec 15, 2022
    • Main Program:   Dec 16 - 17, 2022
    • Post-conference Tutorial / Workshop:   Dec 18, 2022

All deadlines are 11:59:59 PM IST (GMT +5:30).
